page.title: 15Weather In The Birnie Area.
page.content: Birnie is situated near the Moray Firth and as such, enjoys mild weather . For approximately 300 days each year the prevailing winds are from the west . As the Cairngorm Mountains lie only fifty miles to the West, the Moray Firth area finds itself in a Rain Shadow Area. That is, the annual Rainfall figures for Scotland are; West Coast, 60 inches, Cairngorms, 100 inches, Moray Firth 25 inches. Winter temperatures in the Moray Firth area are frequently higher than the surrounding district and roads are rarely blocked by snow unlike the roads to the South and East. This favourable climate is popular with the local people, farmers and the many tourists who visit the area.
